body:
Actually, `fastify.ready` is not strictly equivalent to `fastify(0, cb)`. As an example from a project I am working on:

```js
server.ready((err) => {
  if (err) {
    log.error('could not boot server: %s', err.message)
    log.debug(err.stack)
    log.info('aborting startup')
    process.kill(process.pid, 'SIGTERM')
    process.exit(1)
  }
  server.listen(
    config.get('server').port,
    config.get('server').address,
    serverListenCB
  )
})
```

The difference is that `ready` is fired once all plugin registrations have occurred. In my situation, I need to know that has happened _before_ I fire up the listener.

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Issue or PR that should land as semver patch

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.title: chore(deps): update dependency fastify to v4.29.1

repository.name: ng-cash-backend
repository.description: Projeto backend desenvolvido em NodeJS para capacitação de API Rest. Usando Fastify e Knex como ORM. API de transferências entre usuário.

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>fastify/fastify (fastify)</summary>

### [`v4.29.1`](https://redirect.github.com/fastify/fastify/releases/tag/v4.29.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/fastify/fastify/compare/v4.29.0...v4.29.1)

#### ⚠️ Security Release ⚠️

Fix for ["Invalid content-type parsing could lead to validation bypass"](https://redirect.github.com/fastify/fastify/security/advisories/GHSA-mg2h-6x62-wpwc) and CVE-2025-32442.

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/fastify/fastify/compare/v4.29.0...v4.29.1>
